column4: Can anyone here point me in the direction of the source code for the linux kernel that is shipped with hoary hedgehog current? (5.04 i386) I can't find it on ubuntulinux.com or the mirrors.
No, I want the exact source that is compiled on the cd.
I cannot find it on ubuntulinux.com
Where is the source package then?
I am not, I need the source so that I can install a network driver
And, as per the GPL, the source should be not only on ubuntulinux.org, but also on every mirror.
And it's not a vanilla kernel.  All I see is a diff file that I can download through ftp/http.
I need to install a network driver, I need the kernel source, the version that comes with hoary 5.04.
The presence of a kernel*.diff file tells me that I can't get it from kernel.org
will what i said suffice for you?
that same directory contains an .orig.tar.gz and a .diff.gz if you prefer
in any case, the gpl mandates the sounce be available, and ubuntu discharges that obligation in that directory
no, i'm just pointing out there's an obligation, even if you were not aware :)
